thread.title: Pekin man convicted of attempting to entice a minor
thread.title_full: Pekin man convicted of attempting to entice a minor

author: @25newsweek
title: Pekin man convicted of attempting to entice a minor
text:
Pekin man convicted of attempting to entice a minor
PEORIA (25News Now) - A Pekin man was convicted Wednesday for attempting to entice a minor for sex.
The Department of Justice said the evidence against Joseph Perkins, 32, presented by the government, established that from January 2023 to March 2024, Perkins communicated on an internet-based social media platform with an individual he believed to be a 13-year-old girl, expressing multiple times that he wanted to engage in sex with her.
In March 2024, Perkins drove to a location in Peoria to meet the girl for the purpose of having sexual relations, according to the DOJ.
Federal law enforcement agents arrested him when he arrived at the location.
He is set to be sentenced on August 13.
The statutory penalties for attempted enticement of a minor are a minimum of ten years to life imprisonment, followed by a minimum five-year to life term of supervised release. Perkins remains in the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service.
